images.copyright: The Circus townhouses in Bath, Somerset, England (© Gavin Hellier/Getty Images)
images.title: Jane Austen's literary circle
images.caption: International Literacy Day
images.desc: Jane Austen, author of 'Pride and Prejudice,' is one of the best-known writers in English literature, so it's not a surprise that there are multiple festivals honoring her legacy. The largest is held here, in the English city of Bath, where Austen lived from 1801 to 1806. On September 8, International Literacy Day, the city begins its annual 10-day Jane Austen Festival with hundreds of Austen fans walking the streets dressed in costumes from Britain's Regency era, in the early 19th century.
